notes.title: Specify Phase Overview
notes.content: This is where the journey begins. The specify phase captures the initial user request in natural language, transforming vague ideas into structured requirements.
tips: Emphasize that natural language input is intentional - no special syntax required
Point out how the system identifies key entities and user intents
Mention that this mirrors how teams actually describe features

notes.title: Demonstrating Specification Generation
notes.content: Watch how the system transforms the user story into a structured specification document with acceptance criteria, user stories, and functional requirements.
tips: Highlight the automatic extraction of user stories
Show how acceptance criteria are generated
Note the consistent markdown formatting

notes.title: Clarify Phase Overview
notes.content: The clarify phase identifies gaps and ambiguities in the specification. This demonstrates how the system helps teams catch issues early before implementation begins.
tips: Explain that clarification prevents costly rework later
Mention that this simulates stakeholder feedback loops
Point out that questions are context-aware based on the spec

notes.title: Interactive Clarification
notes.content: In a real workflow, this is where you'd interact with stakeholders or the AI to resolve ambiguities. The demo shows pre-defined clarifications for speed.
tips: Note that real implementations allow iterative Q&A
Highlight that clarifications update the specification
Mention integration with team communication tools

notes.title: Plan Phase Overview
notes.content: The planning phase creates the technical implementation plan. This is where architecture decisions, technology choices, and file structure are determined.
tips: Emphasize that the plan respects existing codebase conventions
Point out constitution principles are checked here
Mention that plans include dependency graphs

notes.title: Constitution Checks in Planning
notes.content: Notice the constitution checks running during plan generation. These ensure the plan adheres to organizational standards and best practices.
tips: Show the constitution panel alongside the plan
Highlight any passing/failing checks
Explain how violations would be flagged and addressed

notes.title: Tasks Phase Overview
notes.content: The tasks phase breaks down the plan into actionable implementation tasks. Each task is atomic, testable, and includes clear success criteria.
tips: Note that tasks include parallel execution markers
Point out dependency relationships between tasks
Mention that task IDs enable tracking and automation

notes.title: Task Breakdown Details
notes.content: Each task includes the file path, description, and any dependencies. Tasks marked [P] can be executed in parallel for faster implementation.
tips: Explain the TDD approach with tests before implementation
Show how tasks reference specific file paths
Highlight the checkpoint markers between phases

notes.title: Implementation Phase Overview
notes.content: The final phase represents the actual code generation. In production, this is where the AI agent executes tasks and writes code.
tips: Mention that implementation follows the task order
Note that each task is validated before moving to the next
Highlight integration with version control

notes.title: Automated Implementation
notes.content: Watch as the system executes tasks sequentially, creating files, writing code, and running tests. The demo shows a simulated implementation flow.
tips: Show the typing animation for code generation
Point out syntax highlighting in the viewer
Mention that real implementations include git commits
